standards.name: Rules of exponents
standards.description: Simplify expressions using the rules of exponents: product rule, quotient rule, power rule, zero exponent, negative exponents. Priority target.

standards.name: Roots and rational exponents
standards.description: Translate between roots and rational exponents. Convert radical notation to exponent form and vice versa.

standards.name: Algebraic properties
standards.description: Apply the distributive, commutative, and associative properties to manipulate expressions involving exponents.

standards.name: Square and cube roots
standards.description: Simplify and evaluate square roots and cube roots without a calculator.

standards.name: Scientific notation
standards.description: Perform operations with numbers expressed in scientific notation, including multiplication, division, and unit conversions.

standards.name: Imaginary numbers
standards.description: Simplify roots of negatives using imaginary numbers (i = √-1).

standards.name: Evaluating expressions
standards.description: Evaluate algebraic expressions by substituting values, including multi-variable expressions with exponents and grouping symbols.

standards.name: Real-life models and formulas
standards.description: Interpret and use formulas that model real-life situations, including multi-step formulas with rates, costs, and compound operations.

standards.name: Modeling real-life situations
standards.description: Write algebraic models (equations, functions) to represent real-world scenarios.

standards.name: Multi-step linear equations
standards.description: Solve linear equations requiring distribution, combining like terms, and variable isolation across multiple steps.

standards.name: Literal equations
standards.description: Solve equations for a specified variable when multiple variables are present (rearranging formulas).

standards.name: Linear inequalities
standards.description: Solve and graph linear inequalities, including multi-step inequalities with fractions and distribution.

standards.name: Graphing inequalities
standards.description: Graph solutions to linear inequalities on a number line with correct open/closed circles and direction.

standards.name: Function composition
standards.description: Evaluate composite functions f(g(x)) using tables, graphs, and algebraic definitions. Includes multi-function composition with f, g, h.

standards.name: Sequence analysis
standards.description: Identify sequences as linear (constant difference), exponential (constant ratio), or neither. Explain reasoning.

standards.name: Graphing functions
standards.description: Create tables of values and graph functions. Identify key features: vertex, intercepts, domain, range. Includes quadratics, square root, rational.

standards.name: Graph analysis
standards.description: Read and interpret graphs: evaluate f(x) from graph, find intervals of increase/decrease, identify domain, range, extrema, intercepts.

standards.name: Real-life applications
standards.description: Model real-world situations with linear functions. Interpret slope and y-intercept in context (rate of change, initial value).

standards.name: Drawing conclusions from graphs
standards.description: Analyze graphs to draw conclusions: predict values, identify trends, extrapolate using slope.

standards.name: Inverse functions
standards.description: Find inverse functions algebraically. Use inverse notation f⁻¹(x). Verify using composition f(f⁻¹(x)) = x.

standards.name: Function operations
standards.description: Perform operations on functions: addition, subtraction, multiplication. Apply to profit/cost/revenue models.

standards.name: Finding inverse functions
standards.description: Solve equations in function notation. Find inverse functions including rational functions. Evaluate inverse at specific values.

standards.name: Function evaluation
standards.description: Evaluate functions at given inputs, including fractions. Identify linear patterns in real-world contexts.

standards.name: Write linear models
standards.description: Write linear equations from verbal descriptions of rates and initial values. Model cost, distance, and other real-world linear relationships.

standards.name: Writing equations from points
standards.description: Write linear equations from two points. Interpret slope and intercepts in context. Calculate costs/values at given inputs.

standards.name: Scatterplots and best fit lines
standards.description: Analyze scatterplots, find line of best fit. Write equations in point-slope and slope-intercept form. Make predictions.

standards.name: Graph linear functions
standards.description: Graph linear functions from equations. Interpret graphs including savings, spending, and rate-based models.

standards.name: Exponential models
standards.description: Write exponential models P(t) = a·b^t from word problems. Distinguish exponential growth from linear growth. Evaluate at given values.

standards.name: Exponential growth
standards.description: Model exponential growth (b > 1). Identify growth rate, initial value, and evaluate future values. Includes population, investment, and bacteria growth.

standards.name: Exponential decay
standards.description: Model exponential decay (0 < b < 1). Identify decay rate, initial value, and evaluate future values. Includes depreciation, temperature cooling, battery drain.

standards.name: Quadratic functions
standards.description: Identify, graph, and analyze quadratic functions. Find vertex, domain, range. Understand transformations.

standards.name: Square root functions
standards.description: Identify, graph, and analyze square root functions. Find domain, range, starting point.

standards.name: Rational functions
standards.description: Identify, graph, and analyze rational functions. Find vertical and horizontal asymptotes, domain, range.

standards.name: Cubic functions
standards.description: Identify, graph, and analyze cubic functions. Find inflection point, domain, range.

standards.name: Function identification
standards.description: Identify function type from graph (quadratic, square root, rational, cubic, exponential). State key features.

standards.name: Sketch parent functions
standards.description: I can sketch graphs of parent functions.

standards.name: Identify transformations
standards.description: I can identify the parent function and transformations from a graph or equation.

standards.name: Graph using transformations
standards.description: I can graph a function using parent shapes and transformations.

standards.name: Write equation from graph
standards.description: I can write an equation for a function given a graph.

standards.name: Function characteristics
standards.description: I can describe characteristics of functions such as domain, range, symmetry, extrema, asymptotes, end behavior, and intervals of increasing or decreasing.

standards.name: Explain solving steps
standards.description: I can explain the reasoning for each step of solving an equation.

standards.name: Solve nonlinear equations
standards.description: I can solve nonlinear equations using inverse operations, including quadratic, power, and radical functions.

standards.name: Solve rational equations
standards.description: I can solve rational equations.

standards.name: Exponential one-to-one property
standards.description: I can solve exponential equations using the one-to-one property.

standards.name: Extraneous solutions
standards.description: I can identify extraneous solutions.

easy.description: Single concept, 1-2 steps. Direct application of one rule or formula.

medium.description: 2-3 concepts combined, 3-4 steps. Requires choosing strategy and applying multiple rules.
examples: Write linear model from word problem

hard.description: 4+ steps, multi-concept integration. Requires problem decomposition, multiple representations, or novel application.
examples: Function composition with tables, graphs, and algebra
